indications: Indications mild to moderate dementia in Alzheimer’s disease
name: DONEPEZIL HYDROCHLORIDE
cautions:
Cautions sick sinus syndrome or
other supraventricular conduction abnormalities; susceptibility to peptic ulcers; asthma, chronic obstructive pulmonary
disease; interactions: Appendix 1 (parasympathomimetics)
side-effects:
Side-effects nausea, vomiting, anorexia, diarrhoea; fatigue,
insomnia, headache, dizziness, syncope, abnormal dreams, hallucinations,
agitation, aggression; muscle cramps; urinary incontinence; rash,
pruritus; less commonly gastric and duodenal ulcers,
gastro-intestinal haemorrhage, bradycardia, seizures; rarely sino-atrial block, AV block, hepatitis, extrapyramidal symptoms;
potential for bladder outflow obstruction
doses:
Initially 5 mg once daily at bedtime, increased if necessary
after one month to max. 10 mg daily
